available.description: Available at the same time of year, every year.
available.name: Seasonal

description: Saison L'été was brewed with fresh eldeflowers, picked from the hedgerows around the brewery. After fermentation, it was aged on whole gooseberries. Which combined with our blend of saison and wild yeast strains gives a tart, thirst quenching taste - perfect for the summer.

style.description: Beers in this category are golden to deep amber in color. There may be quite a variety of characters within this style. Generally: They are light to medium in body. Malt aroma is low to medium-low. Esters are medium to high in  aroma, while, complex alcohols, herbs, spices, low Brettanomyces character and even clove and smoke-like phenolics may or may not be evident in the overall balanced beer. Hop aroma and flavor may be at low to medium levels. Malt flavor is low but provides foundation for the overall balance. Hop bitterness is moderate to moderately assertive. Herb and/or spice flavors, including black pepper-like notes, may or may not be evident. Fruitiness from fermentation is generally in character. A balanced small amount of sour or acidic flavors is acceptable when in balance with other components. Earthy, cellar-like, musty aromas are okay. Diacetyl should not be perceived. Chill or slight yeast haze is okay. Often bottle conditioned with some yeast character and high carbonation. French & Belgian-Style Saison may have Brettanomyces characters that are slightly acidity, fruity, horsey, goaty and/or leather-like.
style.name: French & Belgian-Style Saison

name: Saison L'été

available.description: Available at the same time of year, every year.
available.name: Seasonal

description: The same base recipe as the L’Automne but has been infused with Hawthorne leaves and berries. The result is subtle but distinct, if there is such a flavour as ‘barren’, it is here – in a good wintery way.

name: Saison L'Hiver

available.description: Available year round as a staple beer.
available.name: Year Round

description: A slightly lower alcohol version of the classic farmhouse style. Hazy golden beer with notes of fruit, spice, and funk.

name: Saison Lamoille

available.description: Limited availability.
available.name: Limited

description: Traditional Belgian farmhouse ale brewed with rye, caraway and trace of onion. Four months of barrel aging imparted wild yeasts, adding complexities to the solid dry finish. We cellared this beauty for seven months, allowing it to naturally carbonate.

name: Saison Le Coq

available.description: Available at the same time of year, every year.
available.name: Seasonal

description:
Le Printemps has nettle tips added post fermentation for the gentle 'cut grass' aroma of Springtime. 
Combined with subtle citrus zest and spicy hop character, this beer is hugely refreshing.

description: Sweet and sharp citrus with peppery flavors of traditional farmhouse yeast.

name: Saison Lemon Sour

description: The latest in our rotating saison series. Notes of cantaloupe, watermelon, and bubblegum. Dry hopped with El Dorado.

name: Saison Lillis

description: A farmhouse ale made with orange peel, coriander and lavender and tarragon grown in Brewmaster Brian's garden.

style.name: French & Belgian-Style Saison

name: Saison Locale #3

description:
Saisons are a traditional Belgian farmhouse ale brewed with a combination of herbs and spices that the farmers currently had on hand. They are
intended to be crisp and thirst-quenching for the farmhands. Notes of citrus and clove spice are prominent. We keep with this tradition
and change up the fruits and spices we use for each beer in the series. For batch no. 13, we used lemongrass, pink peppercorn and galangal root.

Saison no. 4 earned us our first medal - it took home Silver at the 2014 Colorado State Fair!

description: A dark saison, brewed with a blend of edible flowers and herbs. Cool and refreshing, like shade from the summer sun.

name: Saison Noel

available.description: Available during the fall months.
available.name: Fall

description: Saison Noir is a dark and earthy farmhouse ale, which we’ve brewed to signify the changing of the seasons.  Malted barley meets a French yeast to complement the deep, roasted notes with a fresh aroma. Saison Noir keenly balances its shadowy character with a rich and inviting presence. Let yourself be snared in its grasp.

name: Saison of the Western Ghats

available.description: Available during the fall months.
available.name: Fall

description: Based on the farmhouse ale style that is generally released in the spring or summer, we darkened the color with chocolate malt and boosted the alcohol to make it more warming. The result was a dark, mysterious beer that has a light body, subtle peppery spiciness, and hints of chocolate in the finish.
name: Saison Oscura

available.name: Fall

description: Notes of pink peppercorn and clove compliment the citrusy nose, subdued esters, and balanced hop bite courtesy of Citra and Cascade.  Belgian Pilsner malt create a soft malt profile that makes this bright and effervescent grapefruit saison the perfect companion to warm sunny days.

description: A deep golden ale, hopped with East Kent Goldings and Willamette hops, spiced with Kaffir Lime Leaves and Paradise Seed.

name: Saison Pécore

description: This beer has four different hops set around a centrepiece Saison yeast. The spicy dry base is layered with rich ripe melon and bubblegum flavours, counterbalanced with a tart citrus finish.

name: Saison Puede

description:
Sturdy farmhouse ale that was traditionally brewed in the winter, to be consumed throughout the summer months. Not so long ago it was close to being an endangered style, but over recent years there's been a massive revival; especially in the US. 

This is a very complex style; many are very fruity in the aroma and flavor. Look for earthy yeast tones, mild to moderate tartness. Lots of spice and with a medium bitterness. They tend to be semi-dry with many only having touch of sweetness.

style.description: Beers in this category are golden to deep amber in color. There may be quite a variety of characters within this style. Generally: They are light to medium in body. Malt aroma is low to medium-low. Esters are medium to high in  aroma, while, complex alcohols, herbs, spices, low Brettanomyces character and even clove and smoke-like phenolics may or may not be evident in the overall balanced beer. Hop aroma and flavor may be at low to medium levels. Malt flavor is low but provides foundation for the overall balance. Hop bitterness is moderate to moderately assertive. Herb and/or spice flavors, including black pepper-like notes, may or may not be evident. Fruitiness from fermentation is generally in character. A balanced small amount of sour or acidic flavors is acceptable when in balance with other components. Earthy, cellar-like, musty aromas are okay. Diacetyl should not be perceived. Chill or slight yeast haze is okay. Often bottle conditioned with some yeast character and high carbonation. French & Belgian-Style Saison may have Brettanomyces characters that are slightly acidity, fruity, horsey, goaty and/or leather-like.
style.name: French & Belgian-Style Saison

name: Saison Renaud

available.description: Available at the same time of year, every year.
available.name: Seasonal

description: Brewed with a French Ale yeast that exhibits an excellent tartness and captivating spicy aromatic, Saison Reprieve is a perfect refreshment for the onset of warmer months.

name: Saison Rue
description: Saison Rue is an unfiltered, bottle conditioned, Belgian/French-style farmhouse ale. This is a beer of subtlety and complexity, with malted rye, spicy, fruity yeast notes, biscuit-like malt backbone, and a slight citrus hop character. With age, this beer will dry out and will become more complex with rustic notes of leather and earth from the contribution of a wild yeast strain. Being a Saison, Saison Rue is ambiguous unto itself as it is a different beer when fresh and when aged. We hope you enjoy it in all of its incarnations.

available.description: Beer is not available.
available.name: Not Available

description:
Belgian-style Saison Brewed with Star Anise, Peppercorns and Fresh Local Lemongrass
Refreshingly light in body, yet full in flavor, Hardywood Saison Rustica combines the best of both worlds for a warm weather beer like no other. A delicate, yet vibrant beer, Saison Rustica’s citrusy lemongrass notes play together in perfect harmony with the prickly spice character from a blend of black, Szechuan and pink peppercorns and finishes with mellow licorice tones offered by freshly cracked star anise. At an approachable 4.5% alcohol, the quaffability of this beer is uncompromising.
Special thanks to David and Barbara from Village Garden for supplying the fresh local lemongrass for Saison Rustica.

name: Saison Sauvignon

available.description: Available year round as a staple beer.
available.name: Year Round

description: Saisons have been around for ages. Traditionally brewed by Belgian and French farmers to provide refreshment during harvest. I'm guessing that flavour wasn't a main concern back then; the priority was to provide a beverage that was safe to drink, because water usually wasn't. Never the less, over time they developed a beverage chrarissed by beer geeks of the modern world. The alcohol content was low, so the workers could consume enough to keep hydrated and still perform their job: To load the barn with enough barley for next years brewing season. I bet these hardworking, humble farmers never imagined, that centuries later, their style of brewing would inspire brewers from all over the world. As all our beers, this is a very modern, you might say new world, interpretation of this style. Based on the tradition we have used a French Saison yeast, which provides a plethora of funky, earthy, very "Belgian" flavours. From there we have upped the ante a fair bit by doubling the amount of malt, and thereby the alcohol, and loaded the kettle with punchy Nelson Sauvin hops. Unlike the original, this is not a beer meant to be drunk by the gallon. Moderation is the key for full enjoyment of all great beers.

malt.description: Aromatic malt is a kilned barley malt used to give beer a strong, aggressive malt aroma and rich color.

characteristics.description: Imparts an aromatic quality upon the beer.
characteristics.name: Aromatic

characteristics.description: Imparts a malty flavor upon the beer.

malt.name: Aromatic Malt

characteristics.description: Imparts a caramel quality upon the beer.
characteristics.name: Caramel

yeast.description: A very versatile strain that produces Saison or farmhouse style biers as well as other Belgian style beers that are highly aromatic (estery), peppery, spicy and citrusy. This strain enhances the use of spices and aroma hops, and is extremely attenuative but leaves an unexpected silky and rich mouthfeel. This strain can also be used to re-start stuck fermentations or in high gravity beers.
yeast.name: French Saison

name: Saison V-10

description: Belgian style Farmhouse Ale. This beer is brewed with pale, munich and a touch of flaked barley. The hops used were German Perle and English First Gold adding a very light hop character to 22 IBU’s. The beer is spiced with coriander, kala jeera and Indian green peppercorns to lend an earthy floral peppery character in the finish. The yeast strain used to ferment this beer came from a small Belgian brewery known to create the wonderful brew known as Saison DuPont.
name: Saison V-50

French & Belgian-Style Saison may have Brettanomyces characters that are slightly acidity, fruity, horsey, goaty and/or leather-like.
style.name: French & Belgian-Style Saison

name: Saison V2

description: Saison Vert is an open fermented wheat based brew made with black limes, giving the otherwise bright beer a darker flavor profile. Layered with spice, citrus, earth, and even walnut notes, Saison Vert goes down easily with tremendous nuance. Several kegs will see out of state distribution, so look for both locally and across the country.

style.description: Beers in this category are golden to deep amber in color. There may be quite a variety of characters within this style. Generally: They are light to medium in body. Malt aroma is low to medium-low. Esters are medium to high in  aroma, while, complex alcohols, herbs, spices, low Brettanomyces character and even clove and smoke-like phenolics may or may not be evident in the overall balanced beer. Hop aroma and flavor may be at low to medium levels. Malt flavor is low but provides foundation for the overall balance. Hop bitterness is moderate to moderately assertive. Herb and/or spice flavors, including black pepper-like notes, may or may not be evident. Fruitiness from fermentation is generally in character. A balanced small amount of sour or acidic flavors is acceptable when in balance with other components. Earthy, cellar-like, musty aromas are okay. Diacetyl should not be perceived. Chill or slight yeast haze is okay. Often bottle conditioned with some yeast character and high carbonation. French & Belgian-Style Saison may have Brettanomyces characters that are slightly acidity, fruity, horsey, goaty and/or leather-like.
style.name: French & Belgian-Style Saison

name: Saison Vert

available.description: Available year round as a staple beer.
available.name: Year Round

description: A traditional Saison, lightly golden in color with lively carbonation. A wonderful nose of white pepper, spice, and fruity esters transitions to a husky, rustic, slightly grainy flavor which melds nicely with the fruity, peppery notes before drifting to a pleasant medium dryness.
